<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Animated Statue](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2820)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Animated statues are often used to guard crypts, small shrines, or areas in government buildings where they can be positioned amid normal statues to hide their true nature until an intruder arouses their ire. Many less scrupulous adventurers, fueled by paranoia that statues will animate and attack, smash any statues they encounter, ruining harmless, ancient relics.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Construct](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

construct armor
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 35

**Hardness**
6
</row>

**Immunities**
bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661) attacks, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91), [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509), [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)

**Construct Armor** Like normal objects, an animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 15.
